title: JCB heir digs in to strike last-gasp Wrightbus rescue
text:
The son of JCB digger tycoon Lord Bamford has struck an eleventh hour deal to buy “Boris Bus” maker Wrightbus.

Jo Bamford announced that an agreement in principle had been hammered out with the company’s owners, the Wright family - drawing days of feisty negotiations to a close.

The agreement clears the main hurdle blocking a rescue of the 73-year-old company.

Mr Bamford will move on to finalising terms with administrator Deloitte.

Last month the Telegraph revealed that the JCB scion had entered the race to save Ballymena-based Wrightbus.
